thread.title: How former MLB slugger Manny Ramirez is helping out the NLCS-bound Chicago Cubs
thread.title_full: How former MLB slugger Manny Ramirez is helping out the NLCS-bound Chicago Cubs | NJ.com

author: Maria Guardado | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: How former MLB slugger Manny Ramirez is helping out the NLCS-bound Chicago Cubs
text:
The Chicago Cubs won their National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals on Tuesday night and advanced to their first NLCS since 2003.
The Cubs have a crop of young hitters, including Anthony Rizzo, Kris Bryant, Kyle Schwarber and Jorge Soler, but they also have another secret weapon who's helping to harness all that offensive talent: Former major league slugger Manny Ramirez.
Ramirez, who hit 555 career home runs during his legendary career in the big leagues, joined the Cubs in 2014 as a player-coach for Triple-A Iowa. He currently serves as an unofficial hitting instructor for the upstart Cubs, helping to mentor many of their young players.
"It's awesome, bro," Ramirez told The Washington Post . "It's unbelievable now that I'm here. It's crazy."
Ramirez has been a particularly invaluable resource for the Cubs' Latino players, such as as the Cuban-born Soler, acting as an interpreter and life coach.
